channel.title: How to start web developing
channel.description: I'm starting web developing but I need some instructions,Like how to match all the pages themes and css and other stuff and how to understand HTML.Thanks :)

item.title: How to start web developing
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:11, topic:550434”]You are not limited to using PHP for your back-end/server, you can use both C# and Java (and many more, but not at the same time) for that. If you want to use PHP go ahead, just know there is alternatives.[/quote]True, but it’s worth noting if you use ASP .NET (C#) I’m pretty sure you need Windows hosting, which is typically more expensive than Linux hosting. Of course, I’m sure there’s a way to run an ASP .NET server on Linux using Mono or ASP .NET vNext but odds are Linux hosting won’t have these services.

Read full topic

item.title: How to start web developing
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

You are not limited to using PHP for your back-end/server, you can use both C# and Java (and many more, but not at the same time) for that. If you want to use PHP go ahead, just know there is alternatives.

Read full topic

item.title: How to start web developing
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I learned how to make this website with literally zero web dev experience in a few days from complete scratch following up to part ~30 of this video series:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PAWT-nyogCk

Note that you don’t actually use any of DW’s features. You only use it for writing HTML and CSS. Then I learned PHP and SQL by looking at user registration/login frameworks, like this one. PHP is probably the easiest language you can ever learn if you know a C-style language. Note that I stopped at part 30 of the tutorial series because the rest of the videos are for the javascript features, and I didn’t want any of my website to use javascript. If you’re fine with it, then maybe you don’t need to learn PHP.

I didn’t use any of the resources on this site, but rather Googled everything I couldn’t figure out myself. Google is your best friend for anything you’re trying to learn.

Read full topic

item.title: How to start web developing
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Draconian Mr.Draconian
item.description:
@Mr.Draconian wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:8, topic:550434”]I’m sure you’re capable of finding your own resources.
If you can’t problem solve on your own, then you’re not cut out for web dev anyway. We don’t mind answering specific questions but we do mind having to spoon feed someone.
Hell, I don’t even know what you’re actually asking. Attempt something first and then ask questions based on your attempt. Provide us with what you’re working on and then we can actually show you where to improve.[/quote]

OK the first problem I got is with css,it wont show up I checked out Ruby’s tutorial.
Here is my HTML Code:

[code]

YOUR SITE TITLE [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: How to start web developing
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

I’m sure you’re capable of finding your own resources.
If you can’t problem solve on your own, then you’re not cut out for web dev anyway. We don’t mind answering specific questions but we do mind having to spoon feed someone.
Hell, I don’t even know what you’re actually asking. Attempt something first and then ask questions based on your attempt. Provide us with what you’re working on and then we can actually show you where to improve.

Read full topic

item.title: How to start web developing
item.dc:creator: @petergr petergr
item.description:
@petergr wrote:

I started developing using wordpress and trying to make small improvements and workarounds. Searching google for what i need, eventually i realised that i learned html and php without knowing Look at my last project that I made. I just wanted to create some online converters for energy like kilojoules to joules converter and other energies for force and heat.

item.title: How to start web developing
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

It should be in the website development board, it’s for all website development discussion.

I posted a pretty huge tutorial in that board at one point, I’d suggest taking a read of it. It’ll give you a good starting point and knowledge of what tags are available to you. https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,617112.0.html

Read full topic
